journal.name: Set a personal teaching goal for using questioning strategies
journal.intro:
Set a goal for incorporating questioning strategies into your teaching practice -- either higher-order teacher questions or student self-questions. If you currently use higher-order questioning in your teaching, write a goal that increases your focus on helping learners use self-questioning. The purpose of setting a goal is to help you have an end in mind, i.e., a way to refine your practice of teaching.

Write your goal so that it is tied to your circumstances, and reflective of your commitment to be a more effective teacher of adult students. Click "Start or edit my journal" entry to submit or update your reflection.

Remember that your goal statements need to be specific enough to ensure change in teaching practice. View the following resource to help you set specific and measurable goal statements.

Steps to Refine your Goals Statements resource
